intro: Hieracium micanticeps, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often glandular. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium micanticeps is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
